companyDescription:
GardaWorld is one of the largest privately owned integrated security, cash solutions and risk management companies in the world.​

Our expertise includes physical and virtual security operations, ​
integrated cash management solutions, security risk management including consulting & crisis response and premiere executive protection, all on a global scale. Our operations take us from our Montreal head office to the oil fields in Iraq, embassies in Africa, leading financial institutions in the United States, and major airports in Canada. ​

Our proven experience and actionable intelligence give us on-the-ground traction across a variety of sectors, including financial services, infrastructure, natural resources, retail and many more. We are a partner ​
of choice for private companies, governments, humanitarian organizations ​
and multinationals all over the world.
description:
Reporting to the Regional Quality Assurance Manager, the Quality Oversight Manager (QOM) is responsible for overseeing compliance to Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) and ensuring the operation is meeting client expectations at all levels. Thorough and observant with a keen eye for detail, Quality Oversight Manager works closely with the frontline and administrative teams to ensure all continuous improvement objectives are met through a combination of oversight and internal audits. They must fully understand the SOP have a sense of responsibility towards the client as well as the operation. 
 TASKS AND DUTIES 
 
  Perform audits and engage in active oversight to SOP compliance and checkpoint performance
   Oversee and document compliance with CATSA's SOPs and GardaWorld BMS across the region
   Provide feedback to Screening Officers and inform Screening Point Managers of findings in a timely manner
   Intervene immediately if parts of the screening process were not completed or if critical aspects of the screening process were performed incorrectly
   Conduct and/or assist audits (CATSA, CGSB, ISO and/or Internal Audits)
   Conduct site inspections, breach investigations and infiltration test investigations
   Observe work procedures independently of the Screening Point Managers and follows through on any SOP not met or understood
   Oversee uniform wear consistent with CATSA's SOPs and inspects each employee during roll call and throughout each shift
   Assist various departments with continuous improvement initiatives
   Identify opportunities for improvement and provide follow-up, positive and constructive feedback
   Assist with the development, issuance and tracking of Corrective Action Plans based on performance evaluations or incidents
   Collect data to measure SOP compliance and Screening Officer performance
   Highlight issues, inconsistencies, and trends in scorecard data to assist departments with continuous improvement and root-cause analysis and internal Performance Improvement Plans
   Other duties as required
 
  REQUIRED SKILLS 
 
  University or College degree in Business Management or Auditing and Assurance preferred
   Previous experience in aviation industry preferred
   Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Outlook, in particular)
   Excellent written, verbal and communication skills
   Able to meet deadlines while working in a fast-paced environment
   Ability to work independently and be a self-starter
   Strong data analysis and analytical skills
   Strong organizational and planning skills in a fast-paced environment
   Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritize work
   Familiarity with internal systems, such as GSKED and CATSA's LMS system is an asset
   Previous experience in auditing in an asset
   Previous experience working in a unionized environment is an asset
   Bilingual in English and French is an asset
   Have a clean criminal record & eligible to obtain a RAIC (security clearance)
